questions.questionText: My customers are saying that Acacia’s 2x600G solution, AC1200, will be available soon. How do I sell against this?  Select ALL that apply.
questions.musicName: Portugal. The Man - Feel It Still.mp3

answers.answerText: No systems with AC1200 are available until at least 1Q2019; Acacia has missed their date many times.
Position WaveLogic 5 Extreme as being a better solution for 50GHz gridded networks.
WaveLogic Ai provides volume-based savings, allowing it to still be very competitive.
Available end 2019, WL5e delivers 800G with a further leapfrog in economics and capacity.
Offer to buy lunch at the most expensive restaurant in the area.

questions.questionText: Which of these statements are true with respect to Ciena’s coherent pluggable strategy? Select ALL that apply

answers.answerText: Ciena will offer 6500-S, 6500-T and Packet Networking devices w/ CFP2-DCO slots in 2019.
Ciena plans to deliver QSFP-DD plugs to address 400ZR applications.
Ciena plans to deliver CFP8 plugs in 1Q2019 for faster time to market.
Ciena plans to deliver 400G in SFP+ pluggables.
Ciena will be offering coherent pluggables for outside plant deployments.
Ciena will be offering CFP2-DCO pluggables mid-2019.

questions.questionText: Cisco, Juniper and Arista are telling your customers they can save “big $” by replacing transport gear with high performance coherent pluggables. How should you respond? Select ALL that apply.
questions.musicName: Born To Be My Baby - Bon Jovi.mp3

answers.answerText: Agree. Coherent pluggables will be able to address all applications in the near term.
Ciena will be offering coherent pluggables starting in Q2 2019.
Deploying a switch/router anywhere you need transponders means a lot more $$$$.
Provide 90% discount on transport equipment.
The thinking that optical networks rely solely on specific FEC gains and power envelope metrics is greatly oversimplifying transport requirements.

questions.questionText: For which situations should you be positioning 6500 RLS to your customer?  Select ALL that apply.

answers.answerText: Greenfield opportunities starting mid-2019 and later.
When customer needs more than 4 degrees of wavelength switching.
When customer is expanding its 6500 network.
For point-point DCI applications.
For applications requiring compact footprint where 600mm depth is acceptable.
For cost reduction versus 6500 photonics.

questions.questionText: You are competing against Nokia and Infinera in your account, each of which can offer C-band solutions today that can be upgraded to L-band in future. Your customer is leasing fiber, and wants to move forward with INFN or NOK to future-proof their network.  How should you respond?  (Choose the SINGLE best option)

answers.answerText: It is cheaper to build another C-band line system than upgrade to C+L.
Deploy 6500 RLS C-band photonic line today with seamless upgrade to L-band next year.
Describe operational challenges of NOK/INFN solution; best to wait for RLS C&L.
Describe operational and capacity inefficiencies of NOK/INFN solution; best to wait for RLS C&L.
Propose the Ciena 6500 S-Series C+L submarine hardware for their application.

questions.questionText: Your customer wants you to bid an open line system so that they have the flexibility of deploying any vendor’s coherent transponders on the network. You know that lowest first-in cost is key criteria for this long-time 6500 customer. Select the TWO best options for this scenario.
questions.musicName: Eddie Money - Take Me Home TonightBe My Baby.mp3

answers.answerText: State that Ciena does not sell line systems without transponders.
Quote a 6500 line system at slightly higher than typical line system margin, with SW licenses for future capacity additions.
Position the 6500 RLS platform at typical line system margins.
Quote a 6500 photonic line system at higher price/margins.
Quote a 6500 line system at your customer’s typical line system margins, with a stipulation that 80% of the transponders are Ciena transponders.

questions.questionText: My customer is interested in T-Series, but requires greater than 100G DWDM. Which options should I position? Select ALL that apply.

answers.answerText: Sell them the CoreDirector.
Use 5xQSFP28 T-Series card with AOC cable to a 6500 WLAi MOTR.
Position the Z-Series with the WaveLogic 3 Nano-based PSW card.
Bid the 500G Universal Sub-Slot card with WaveLogic Ai pluggable modules.
Walk Away.

questions.questionText: My customer is very interested in the Groove G30 for it’s diversity of features and configuration.  What capabilities should I position in 2019 to compete? Select ALL that apply.

answers.answerText: Waveserver Ai 400G data encryption, which is not available on the G30.
400G economics for 10G services with the 10G multiplexer sled on Waveserver Ai.
Point out that Infinera has publicly stated they are implementing PIC on G30; future support and backwards compatibility for today’s G30 is uncertain.
Bid Waveserver Ai for dense DWDM mux/demux application.
Best network economics today and for the near future.

questions.questionText: My customer requires low cost, lower capacity OTN switching with coherent DWDM, and Cisco is bidding the 2xCFP2-ACO crossponder in the NCS 2000 pizzabox platform. What can I position? Select ALL that apply.
questions.musicName: ACDC - You Shook Me All Night Long.mp3

answers.answerText: 6500-S8 with new QSFP28 PKT/OTN card mid-2019, connecting to WLAi MOTR via AOC cable.
The Universal Sub-Slot card with 12 x SFP+ module on the T-Series offered mid-2019.
The 6500 S-Series 2X100G ADM on-a-blade with CFP2-DCO being offered mid-2019.
The 6500 S-Series with CFP2-DCO PKT/OTN I/F card being released mid-2019.
6500 RLS with 32 switching degrees in compact footprint available mid-2019.

questions.questionText: When Ciena introduces Wavelogic 5 Extreme at the end of 2019 - what are the main benefits of this technology? Select ALL that apply.
questions.musicName: Calvin Harris, Dua Lipa - One Kiss.mp3

answers.answerText: Industry leading capacity/wavelength at 800G for single-span DCI applications.
400Gb/s+ economics for long haul applications.
Leading spectral efficiency and maximum wavelength capacity for subsea applications.
Pluggable in a QSFP-DD.
It enables 80% reduction in cost/bit compared to WaveLogic Ai.

questions.questionText: How can you leverage Ciena’s strength and optical position in your account to expand business with Ciena? Select ALL that apply.
questions.musicName: Meat Loaf - I'd Do Anything for Love.mp3

answers.answerText: Offer TDM evolution strategy and new Ethernet services using the 6500 PTS platform.
Position Ciena’s new access portfolio with integrated pluggable coherent optics as your customers move towards deploying high capacity access architectures.
Position combo of packet and optical in new platforms like 8180 and 5170 for end-end Ethernet business solution offering.
Convince your customer to become a leading provider of new 400GbE services by leveraging Ciena’s industry leading 400G portfolio.
Position Liquid Spectrum and BP MCP to help customers gain operational efficiencies to meet their profitability goals.

questions.questionText: How can you “Change the Game” in bid responses to win into new accounts? Select ALL that apply.
questions.musicName: Guns N' Roses - Sweet Child O' Mine.mp3

answers.answerText: Leverage programmability of WaveLogic Ai to get best cost per bit.
Don’t charge anything for hardware and make it up with SW licenses.
Design to fewer but higher capacity channels to come in at lowest cost/Gig, leveraging Liquid Spectrum analytics apps.
Leverage Layer 0 restoration to minimize transponder, and switch/router ports.
Sell the 6500 RLS base configuration with minimal software to win into new accounts, enabling future upsell on photonic SW features.

questions.questionText: What is Ciena’s differentiating value prop as an optical network solutions provider? Choose the SINGLE best response.
questions.musicName: Bon Jovy - Living on a Prayer-beep.mp3

answers.answerText: Ciena is #1 or #2 in every optical networking category we play in.
Ciena has industry-leading coherent solutions.
Combo of coherent technology innovation + programmable HW + financial strength.
Combo of coherent technology innovation + programmable HW + virtualization.
Awesome people
